**Current Status:**
- Ante: 5/8 (need to beat 3 more antes)
- In SHOP phase
- Money: $18
- Just sold Blue Joker, now have 4/5 jokers

**Current Jokers:**
1. Odd Todd - +31 chips per odd rank scored (A, 9, 7, 5, 3)
2. Ancient Joker - X1.5 Mult per Club card scored
3. Swashbuckler - +8 Mult (now +8 instead of +10 since I sold Blue Joker)
4. Even Steven - +4 Mult per even rank scored

**Shop Items:**
1. Smeared Joker - $7 (Hearts/Diamonds same, Spades/Clubs same)
2. Mega Arcana Pack - $8
3. Standard Pack - $4
4. Seed Money Voucher - $10

**My Plan:**
I just sold Blue Joker for $2, going from $16 to $18. Now I need to buy Smeared Joker for $7, which will leave me with $11.

The Smeared Joker will make Spades and Clubs count as the same suit, so both will trigger Ancient Joker's X1.5 Mult effect. This is a strong synergy that should give me much better scaling than the flat +104 chips from Blue Joker.

With $11 remaining, I'll generate $2 interest ($5 threshold = $1, $10 threshold = $2).

**Next Action:**
I should buy the Smeared Joker at position 1 in the card section.

, giving 3.375x

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

reasoning:
Let me analyze the current game state:

**Current Hand:**
1. Ace of Spades (+11 chips) - Odd rank, Spade (counts as Club with Smeared Joker)
2. 9 of Spades (+9 chips) - Odd rank, Spade (counts as Club with Smeared Joker)
3. 4 of Spades (+4 chips) - Even rank, Spade (counts as Club with Smeared Joker)
4. 6 of Hearts (+6 chips) - Even rank, Heart
5. 4 of Hearts (+4 chips) - Even rank, Heart (pairs with 4 of Spades)
6. King of Clubs (+10 chips) - Even rank, Club
7. Queen of Clubs (+10 chips) - Even rank, Club
8. 7 of Clubs (+7 chips + 30 extra chips) - Odd rank, Club, Bonus enhancement

**Possible Hands:**
- Pair of 4s (4 of Spades, 4 of Hearts)
- Flush: 5 Spades/Clubs (Ace, 9, 4 of Spades + King, Queen, 7 of Clubs) = 6 cards actually, so I can make a flush with 5 of them
- Thanks to Smeared Joker, Spades and Clubs count as the same suit!

**Joker Effects:**
1. Odd Todd: +31 chips per odd rank (A, 9, 7)
2. Ancient Joker: X1.5 Mult per Club card (Spades count as Clubs now!)
3. Swashbuckler: +11 Mult
4. Even Steven: +4 Mult per even rank (10, 8, 6, 4, 2)
5. Smeared Joker: Hearts/Diamonds same, Spades/Clubs same


ades: +4 chips, Even rank, Spade/Club (X1.5 from Ancient)
- King of Clubs: +10 chips, Even rank, Club (X1.5 from Ancient)
- 7 of Clubs: +7 chips + 30 bonus, Odd rank (+31 from Odd Todd), Club (X1.5 from Ancient)

The flush with these five cards triggers multiple multipliers. I get X1.5 from Ancient Joker for each of the five cards in the flush (all count as Clubs), plus +31 chips from Odd Todd for the three odd-ranked cards (Ace, 9, 7). The base chips total 41, and with the bonus on the 7, I'm looking at strong chip generation. The multiplier stack from Ancient Joker alone gives me X7.59 (1.5^5), and Swashbuckler adds another +11 Mult on top. + 93 = 214 chips total.

For multipliers, the base is 6, Swashbuckler adds 11, Even Steven contributes 8 from the two even cards, bringing the additive multipliers to 25. Ancient Joker multiplies by 1.5 for each of the five Clubs and Spades in the hand, resulting in 7.59375x. Multiplying everything together: 214 × 25 × 7.59375 = 40,625 chips, which comfortably exceeds the 11,000 blind requirement.

The optimal selection is positions 1, 2, 3, 6, and 8—the Ace of Spades, 9 of Spades, 4 of Spades, King of Clubs, and 7 of Clubs.
